title: Caramelized Onion Chicken Tenders
ingredients: 1 pound chicken breast tenders (skinless, chicken breast, cut into 1-inch strips)
¼ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Prepare the chicken by removing any remaining fat, wash in cold water, dry it well using paper towels, and cut into 1-inch strips.  Sprinkle the chicken with salt and pepper.

Heat the oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat.  Add the onion and sauté for 2 minutes.  Add the chicken tenders and sauté for approximately 8 minutes; or until the chicken is done.  Remove the onion and chicken from the skillet.

Add the jam and all the remaining ingredients to the skillet; cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly with a whisk.  Return the chicken and onions to the pan and cook the mixture for approximately 4 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Source:  Cooking Light (Included in:  A Menu of Spring Favorites by Lidia Matticchio Bastianich article), Texas Taste Section, Dallas Morning News, .
